{{disambig-two: '''''umbar''''' is a noun meaning "fate" in [[Quenya]].<ref name="Names">{{App
the Quenya word: Letters}}, Note, ''The names of the letters''</ref>

left]]''Umbar'' is also the name in Quenya of the sixth letter of the [[Tengwar]] alphabet.<ref name="Names"/>  It is the second letter of the second grade or [[Tyellë]], which contains "voiced stops" and it is the second letter in the labial or ''p''-series of consonants, the ''[[Parmatéma]]''.<ref name="Letters">{{App
the Haven south of Gondor: Letters}}</ref>  In the standard spelling of Quenya ''Umbar'' represents '''MB'''.<ref>{{App
[[Umbar]]}}: Letters}}, Note</ref>  In all other modes this letter represents '''B'''.<ref name="Letters"/>  The Westron name for this letter is '''''Bí'''''.<ref>See [[Westron Tengwar]]</ref>

{{disambig-two: The word ''[[ambar]]'' ("doom") may be a variant.  The word derives from the [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarmë
the Haven south of Gondor: Etymologies}}, MBARAT-</ref>  It is also possible that ''umbar'' contains the prefix ''[[u-]]'' (''u + ambar''), meaning that it has mainly negative and dark connotations compared to plain ''ambar'', like ''[[Úmarth]]''.
